intro: Reseda alba var. macrantha, commonly known as white sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Reseda alba var. macrantha is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
